pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:5.1: 37. The training rule on asking for rice and bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:6.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:6.4: At that time the monks from the group of six ate rice and bean curry after asking for it for themselves.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:6.6: “How could the Sakyan ascetics eat rice and bean curry after asking for it for themselves?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.1: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.2: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.3: “How can the monks from the group of six eat rice and bean curry after asking for it for themselves?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.7: Foolish men, how can you eat rice and bean curry after asking for it for yourselves?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:7.9: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:8.2: ‘“I will not ask for bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:9.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.2: Soon afterwards a number of monks were sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.3: Monks who were looking after them asked,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.4: “We hope you’re bearing up; we hope you’re getting better?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.5: “Previously we ate rice and bean curry after asking for it, and then we were comfortable.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.7: that this has been prohibited by the Master, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.9: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat rice and bean curry after asking for it for himself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:10.10: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:11.1: ‘“When not sick, I will not ask for bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:12.1: When one is not sick, one should not ask for bean curry or rice for oneself and then eat it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:12.2: If a monk who is not sick, out of disrespect, asks for bean curry or rice for himself and then eats it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:13.7: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:13.8: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:13.9: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:13.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:14.1: The seventh training rule is finished.
